flawed_nl_solution:
On the first day, he ate half the gummy worms, so he had G / 2 gummy worms.
On the second day, he ate half of the remaining gummy worms, so he had G / 2 / 2 = G / 4 gummy worms.
On the third day, he ate another half, so he had G / 4 / 2 = G / 8 gummy worms.
On the fourth day, he ate another half and had 4 left, so he had G / 8 / 2 = G / 61 = 4 gummy worms.
Thus, there were G = 4 * 61 = <<4*61=244>>244 gummy worms in the bag when Carlos bought it.
#### 244

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 16, not 61. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
